query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the territory line of business.
  • CreationDate; string; The date the territory line of business was created.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date the territory line of business was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The login of the user who last updated the territory line of business.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the territory line of business.
  • LobCode; string; The code for the line of business.
  • Meaning; string; The meaning of the line of business.
  • TerrLobId; integer; The unique identifier of the line of business.
  • TerritoryVersionId; integer; The unique identifier of the territory version.
  • UniqueTerritoryNumber; string; The unique territory number of the territory line of business.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • LobFinder: Finds the line of business by the specified LobCode.
    Finder Variables:
    • LobCode; string; The code for the line of business.
  • PrimaryKey: Finds the line of business by the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • TerrLobId; integer; The unique identifier of the line of business.
  • TerritoryLOBIdBasedAltKey: Finds the territory line of business with the specified identifier based on the alternate key.
    Finder Variables:
    • LobCode; string; The code for the line of business.
    • TerritoryVersionId; integer; The unique identifier of the territory version.
  • TerritoryLineOfBusinessAltKeyRowFinder: The lookup type for the line of business.
    Finder Variables:
    • LobCode; string; The code for the line of business.
    • LookupType; string; The lookup type for the line of business.
    • UniqueTerritoryNumber; string; The unique territory number of the territory line of business.

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • CoverageModel; string; Indicates if the dimensions of the territory are based on account attributes or partner attributes.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the territory.
  • CreationDate; string; The date the territory was created.
  • Description; string; The description of the territory.
  • EffectiveEndDate; string; The date and time when the territory version becomes inactive.
  • EffectiveStartDate; string; The date and time when the territory version becomes active. If the StatusCode is DRAFT, then this value should be empty. Else, if the StatusCode is FINALIZED, then this value should be today's date.
  • EligibleForQuotaFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the territory is going to change during a territory realignment. If the value is True, then the territory is unlikely to change during a major realignment, and therefore a quota can be entered against the proposed definition. The default value is true.
  • ForecastParticipationCode; string; The code for the forecast participation. The accepted values are: REVENUE, NONREVENUE, REVENUE_AND_NONREVENUE, and NON_FORECASTING.
  • ForecastedByParentTerritoryFlag; boolean; Indicates if the forecast for the territory is made by its parent territory. The default value is false.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; The date the territory was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The login of the user who last updated the territory.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the territory.
  • LatestVersionFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the territory is the latest active version. If the value is True, then the territory version is the latest active version of the territory.
  • Name; string; The name of the territory.
  • Owner; string; The owner of the territory.
  • OwnerEmail; string; The email address of the owner.
  • OwnerResourceId; integer; The unique identifier of the owner resource.
  • OwnerResourceNumber; string; The registry ID of the owner.
  • ParentTerritoryId; integer; The unique identifier of the parent territory.
  • ParentTerritoryLovSwitcher; string; The field controls the display of parent territory list of values on the UI. This attribute is used for an internal purpose.
  • ParentTerritoryNumber; string; The number of the parent territory.
  • ParentUniqueTerritoryNumber; string; The unique territory number of the parent territory.
  • PartnerId; integer; The unique identifier of the partner associated with the territory.
  • PartnerName; string; The name of the partner associated with the territory.
  • PartnerNumber; string; The number of the partner.
  • PartnerProgramId; integer; The unique identifier of the partner program in which the partner is enrolled.
  • ProgramName; string; The name of the partner program to which the partner is enrolled.
  • ProposalNumber; string; The number of the proposal the territory is associated with.
  • ReviseQuotaFlag; boolean; Indicates whether a submitted quota needs to be revised.
  • RevisionDescription; string; The description of the reason for revising the quota.
  • RevisionReason; string; The user-defined reason for revising the quota.
  • SourceTerrId; integer; The unique identifier of the territory from which the dimensions are inherited.
  • SourceTerrLastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the source territory was last updated. This attribute is related to the inheritance of dimensions by recipient territories from source territories.
  • SourceTerrName; string; The name of the territory from which the selected dimensions are inherited.
  • SourceTerrVersionId; integer; The unique identifier of the source territory version.
  • SourceUniqueTerritoryNumber; string; The unique territory number of the source territory.
  • StatusCode; string; The code indicating the status of the territory. The accepted values are DRAFT and FINALIZED.
  • TerrProposalId; integer; The unique identifier of the territory proposal.
  • TerritoryFunctionCode; string; Business function associated with the territory
  • TerritoryHierarchyUniqueTerritoryNumber; string; The unique alternate identifier of the territory at the top of the hierarchy to be exported.
  • TerritoryId; integer; The unique identifier of the territory.
  • TerritoryLevel; integer; The level of the territory in the territory hierarchy.
  • TerritoryNumber; string; The unique alternate identification number for the territory.
  • TerritoryVersionId; integer; The unique identifier of the territory version.
  • TypeCode; string; The code indicating the type of the territory. For example, PRIME or OVERLAY.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

item.description:
The sales territories resource represents the list of sales territories that the logged-in user can view. A sales territory is an organizational domain with boundaries defined by attributes of customers, products, services, resources, and so on. Sales territories can be created based on multiple criteria including postal code, area code, country, vertical market, size of company, product expertise, and geographical location. 
Sales territories form the fundamental infrastructure of sales management as they define the jurisdiction that salespeople have over sales accounts, or the jurisdiction that channel sales managers have over partners and partner transactions.
